newsitem.title: SPAIN: Two unions set Aug weekend Spain airport strikes.
newsitem.headline: Two unions set Aug weekend Spain airport strikes.

text.p: Spanish airport authority AENA said on Thursday that two trade unions, the Workers Commission (CCOO) and the Workers Trade Union (USO) called four two-day strikes for workers at the 40 civil airports in Spain.
But spokesman also told Reuters that two other unions, the General Workers Union (UGT) and USCA, the trade union of air traffic controllers, were not participating in these strikes.
Strikes are called for every August week-end with one exceptions. Strikes will be held on August 2/3, 9/10, 16/17 and 30/31. The workers involved are ground support personnel.
"It's too early to know the effect these strikes will really have on traffic," he said.
By the start of the strike, the government should have approved plans to guarantee minimum air service.
AENA manages the network of all civil airports in Spain, for both passengers and cargo. It has staff of more than 10,000 workers, of which more than 2,000 are air traffic controllers.
